summary:
## Mosquitoes: Tiny Blood-Sucking Flies

Mosquitoes are small flies with long, thin bodies and one pair of wings. There are over 3,600 species. While all mosquitoes eat nectar, some female mosquitoes also drink blood from animals.

Mosquitoes go through four life stages: egg, larva, pupa, and adult. Larvae live in water and eat algae and other materials. Adult females bite animals and can spread diseases like malaria and dengue fever. Mosquitoes cause over 725,000 deaths each year from these diseases.
title: Mosquito
